definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: Scenes from our childhood still appear vividly before us.
sentences.chinese: 我们童年时代的光景还历历在目。
快乐，悲伤，全都历历在目。

sentences.english: The scene was still fresh in our memory.
sentences.chinese: 当年的情景仍然历历在目。

sentences.english: Think of the scenes over the years, still vividly clear.
sentences.chinese: 想想这些年的情景，还是历历在目。

sentences.english: As her name comes up, many memories arise .
sentences.chinese: 一提起她的名字，许多往事历历在目。

sentences.english: But the sea still shone in the distance and the ship was plainly discernible.
sentences.chinese: 但是远处仍然是波光鳞鳞的大海，那大船历历在目。

sentences.english: So I remember that very well, as matter of fact.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我记得很清楚，历历在目。

sentences.english: Twenty years after its fall, the Berlin Wall still evokes a variety of painful images.
sentences.chinese: 在柏林墙倒塌20年后，很多痛苦景象依然历历在目。

sentences.english: Occasionally I think back the moment when I met you, it seems like no long.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔，我会回想起我们的初遇，一切仍然历历在目。

sentences.english: Everything seems clear, but we can't touch.
sentences.chinese: 一切看起来似乎历历在目，却又无法触及。

definition: to remain fresh in one's memory (idiom)
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
to recall/to think of/to call to mind
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago
things have remained the same, but people have changed
see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
